name: Nikiel's conjecture
rephrased: A compact topological space can be mapped continuously onto a totally ordered set if and only if it is monotonically normal.
implication_form: If a compact topological space is monotonically normal, then it is the continuous image of a total order.
explained: Nikiel's conjecture states that a compact topological space is the continuous image of a compact Hausdorff total order (i.e., a compact linearly ordered topological space) if and only if it is a monotonically normal space. This characterization was formulated by Jacek Nikiel in 1986 and proven by Mary Ellen Rudin in 1999. The conjecture provides a topological characterization (in terms of monotonic normality) of spaces that arise as continuous images of compact linear orders.
